00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *
00050  *  File:  lmdes.c
00051  *
00052  *  Description:
00053  *    Reads in a low-level mdes file and builds all the necessary
00054  *    structures and arrays.
00055  *
00056  *  Creation Date :  May, 1993
00057  *
00058  *  Authors:  John C. Gyllenhaal, Scott Mahlke, Wen-mei Hwu
00059  *
00060 \*****************************************************************************/
00061 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00062 #include <config.h>
00063 #include <string.h>

00067 #include "lmdes.h"
00068 #include <library/l_alloc_new.h>

00071 
00072 /* Pointer through which the current LMDES is accessed */
00073 Mdes *lmdes;
00074 
00075 /* The version of the lmdes file this routine is expecting */
00076 #define MDES_VERSION 3
00077 
00078 /* Internal functions, do not use externally */
00079 static Mdes *load_lmdes (char *file_name);
00080 void Malloc_struct (void **ptr, int size);
00081 void Malloc_name (char **ptr, char *name);
00082 
00083 /* Info structures for structures that can be dynamically allocated */
00084 static L_Alloc_Pool *Mdes_Info_pool = NULL;
00085 static L_Alloc_Pool *Mdes_Compatable_Alt_pool = NULL;
00086 
00087 /*
00088  * Returns 1 if a MDES file has been loaded (L_init_lmdes called)
00089  * returns 0 otherwise.
00090  * Useful for determining if a L_init_lmdes should be called.
00091  */
00092 int
00093 lmdes_initialized (void)
00094 {
00095   if (lmdes == NULL)
00096     return (0);
00097   else
00098     return (1);
00099 }
00100 /*
00101  * Returns 1 if opcode is specified in the mdes file.
00102  * Returns 0 if not.
00103  * Useful for gathering stats on all mdes opcodes in a pass.
00104  */
00105 int
00106 mdes_defined_opcode (unsigned int opcode)
00107 {
00108   /* See if opcode is in lmdes op_table */
00109   if ((opcode > lmdes->max_opcode) || (lmdes->op_table[opcode] == NULL))
00110     {
00111       return (0);
00112     }
00113 
00114   /* Otherwise, legal opcode */
00115   return (1);
00116 }
00117 
00118 /*
00119  * Returns the maximum opcode defined in the mdes file.
00120  */
00121 int
00122 mdes_max_opcode (void)
00123 {
00124   return (lmdes->max_opcode);
00125 }
00126 
00127 /*  
00128  * Returns 1 if any of the alt_flags specified by mask are set for the 
00129  * opcode passed.
00130  *
00131  * Returns 0 otherwise.
00132  */
00133 int
00134 op_flag_set (unsigned int opcode, int mask)
00135 {
00136   /* Make sure opcode is valid */
00137   if ((opcode > lmdes->max_opcode) || (lmdes->op_table[opcode] == NULL))
00138     {
00139       I_punt ("op_flag_set: opcode (%i) not defined in mdes file %s",
00140               opcode, lmdes->file_name);
00141     }
00142 
00143   if ((lmdes->op_table[opcode]->op_flags & mask) != 0)
00144     return (1);
00145   else
00146     return (0);
00147 }
00148 
00149 /*
00150  * Returns 1 if any of the alt_flags specified by mask are set for the 
00151  * specified alternative.
00152  * 
00153  * Returns 0 otherwise.
00154  */
00155 int
00156 alt_flag_set (unsigned int opcode, unsigned int alt_no, int mask)
00157 {
00158   Mdes_Operation *op = NULL;
00159 
00160   /* Make sure valid opcode specified */
00161   if ((opcode > lmdes->max_opcode) ||
00162       ((op = lmdes->op_table[opcode]) == NULL))
00163     {
00164       I_punt ("alt_flag_set: opcode (%i) not defined in mdes file %s",
00165               opcode, lmdes->file_name);
00166     }
00167 
00168   /* Make sure valid alt_no specified */
00169   if (alt_no >= op->num_alts)
00170     {
00171       I_punt ("alt_flag_set: alt (%i) >= number of alts (%i)\n",
00172               alt_no, op->num_alts);
00173     }
00174 
00175   if ((op->alt[alt_no].alt_flags & mask) != 0)
00176     return (1);
00177   else
00178     return (0);
00179 }
00180 /*  
00181  * Returns 1 if any of the alt_flags specified by mask are set for any 
00182  * of the compatable alternatives for the opcode passed.
00183  * "The compatable alternatives" are those which have the 
00184  * operand types which match the instruction being scheduled.
00185  *
00186  * Returns 0 otherwise.
00187  */
00188 int
00189 any_alt_flag_set (Mdes_Info * mdes_info, int mask)
00190 {
00191   Mdes_Compatable_Alt *comp_alt;
00192 
00193   for (comp_alt = mdes_info->compatable_alts; comp_alt != NULL;
00194        comp_alt = comp_alt->next)
00195     {
00196       if ((comp_alt->alt->alt_flags & mask) != 0)
00197         return (1);
00198     }
00199   return (0);
00200 }
00201

00203  * Returns the total number of src, dest and pred operands
00204  * Will be made into macro later.
00205  */
00206 int
00207 mdes_operand_count (void)
00208 {
00209   return (lmdes->operand_count);
00210 }
00211 
00212 /*
00213  * Returns the total number of src, dest, pred, sync_in, and sync_out
00214  * operands.  Will be made into macro later.
00215  */
00216 int
00217 mdes_latency_count (void)
00218 {
00219   return (lmdes->latency_count);
00220 }
00221 
00222 /*
00223  * Returns the number of operands of the specific type there are
00224  */
00225 int
00226 mdes_num_operands (unsigned int operand_type)
00227 {
00228   if (lmdes == NULL)
00229     I_punt ("mdes_num_operands: mdes file not loaded");
00230 
00231   if (operand_type > 4)
00232     I_punt ("mdes_num_operands: operand_type %i out of bounds", operand_type);
00233 
00234   return (lmdes->number[operand_type]);
00235 }
00236 
00237 /*
00238  * Returns the null operand external id 
00239  */
00240 int
00241 mdes_null_operand (void)
00242 {
00243   return (lmdes->null_external_id);
00244 }

00246 /*
00247  * Given an operand index, it prints out the operand type and
00248  * which operand number to out.
00249  */
00250 void
00251 print_mdes_operand_name (FILE * out, Mdes * mdes, unsigned int index)
00252 {
00253   int operand_number;
00254 
00255   if (index >= mdes->latency_count)
00256     {
00257       fprintf (out, "operand index (%i) out of bounds", index);
00258       return;
00259     }
00260 
00261   if (index >= mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_OUT])
00262     {
00263       operand_number = index - mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_OUT];
00264       fprintf (out, "MDES_SYNC_OUT[%i]", operand_number);
00265     }
00266   else if (index >= mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_IN])
00267     {
00268       operand_number = index - mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_IN];
00269       fprintf (out, "MDES_SYNC_IN[%i]", operand_number);
00270     }
00271   else if (index >= mdes->offset[MDES_SRC])
00272     {
00273       operand_number = index - mdes->offset[MDES_SRC];
00274       fprintf (out, "MDES_SRC[%i]", operand_number);
00275     }
00276   else if (index >= mdes->offset[MDES_DEST])
00277     {
00278       operand_number = index - mdes->offset[MDES_DEST];
00279       fprintf (out, "MDES_DEST[%i]", operand_number);
00280     }
00281   else if (index >= mdes->offset[MDES_PRED])
00282     {
00283       operand_number = index - mdes->offset[MDES_PRED];
00284       fprintf (out, "MDES_PRED[%i]", operand_number);
00285     }
00286   else
00287     {
00288       I_punt ("print_mdes_operand_name: index %i not found", index);
00289     }
00290 
00291 }
00292 
00293 /*
00294  * Returns 1 if IO_sets set1 and set2 have at least one bit set
00295  * in common.
00296  * Otherwise, returns 0.
00297  */
00298 static int
00299 IO_sets_intersect (Mdes * mdes, Mdes_IO_Set * set1, Mdes_IO_Set * set2)
00300 {
00301   int i;
00302 
00303   for (i = 0; i < mdes->IOmask_width; i++)
00304     {
00305       /* Return 1 if this part of the mask has a common bit set */
00306       if ((set1->mask[i] & set2->mask[i]) != 0)
00307         return (1);
00308     }
00309 
00310   /* Masks don't intersect, return 0 */
00311   return (0);
00312 }
00313 
00314 static int
00315 IO_items_compatable (Mdes * mdes, Mdes_IO_Set ** operand_type1,
00316                      Mdes_IO_Set ** operand_type2)
00317 {
00318   int i;
00319 
00320   /* Test all the operands for compatablitiy */
00321   for (i = 0; i < mdes->operand_count; i++)
00322     {
00323       /* If the operand i is not compatable, return 0 */
00324       if (!IO_sets_intersect (mdes, operand_type1[i], operand_type2[i]))
00325         {
00326           return (0);
00327         }
00328     }
00329   /* All operands compatable, return 1 */
00330   return (1);
00331 }
00332 
00333 /* 
00334  * Prints out IO_Set name for the given external id.
00335  */
00336 void
00337 mdes_print_IO_set (FILE * out, unsigned int id)
00338 {
00339   if ((id > lmdes->max_IO_set_id) || (lmdes->IO_set_table[id] == NULL))
00340     {
00341       fprintf (out, "(Illegal IO_Set id %i) ", id);
00342     }
00343   else
00344     {
00345       fprintf (out, "%-5s ", lmdes->IO_set_table[id]->name);
00346     }
00347 }
00348 
00349 /*
00350  * Builds the compatable alt list for the operation.
00351  * Returns an Mdes_Info structure with this list in it.
00352  *
00353  * Returns NULL on error.
00354  */
00355 Mdes_Info *
00356 build_mdes_info (unsigned int opcode, int *io_list)
00357 {
00358   Mdes_Info *info;
00359   Mdes_Operation *op;
00360   Mdes_Compatable_Alt *tail, *comp_alt;
00361   Mdes_Alt *alt;
00362   Mdes_IO_Set **operand_type, **alt_operand_type;
00363   int i;
00364 
00365   /* Punt if opcode not defined */
00366   if ((opcode > lmdes->max_opcode) || (lmdes->op_table[opcode] == NULL))
00367     {
00368       fprintf (stderr,
00369                "build_mdes_info: opcode %i undefined in lmdes (%s)\n",
00370                opcode, lmdes->file_name);
00371       return (NULL);
00372     }
00373 
00374   /* Get the operation the opcode corresponds to */
00375   op = lmdes->op_table[opcode];
00376 
00377   /*
00378    * Build operand_type list from io_list 
00379    * use mdes->operand_type_buf to hold the io_list_types
00380    * (so I don't need to keep mallocing/freeing stuff)
00381    */
00382   operand_type = lmdes->operand_type_buf;
00383   for (i = 0; i < lmdes->operand_count; i++)
00384     {
00385       /* Make sure valid operand type specified */
00386       if ((io_list[i] > lmdes->max_IO_set_id) ||
00387           (lmdes->IO_set_table[io_list[i]] == NULL))
00388         {
00389           fprintf (stderr, "build_mdes_info: ");
00390           print_mdes_operand_name (stderr, lmdes, i);
00391           fprintf (stderr, " = %i. Undefined in lmdes (%s)\n",
00392                    io_list[i], lmdes->file_name);
00393           return (NULL);
00394         }
00395       operand_type[i] = lmdes->IO_set_table[io_list[i]];
00396     }
00397 
00398   /* Allocate and initialize mdes_info structure */
00399   info = (Mdes_Info *) L_alloc (Mdes_Info_pool);
00400   info->opcode = opcode;
00401   info->compatable_alts = NULL;
00402   info->num_compatable_alts = 0;
00403 
00404   /* 
00405    * Test all the alts for compatable alts given this io_list,
00406    * and build compatable alt list
00407    */
00408   tail = NULL;
00409   for (i = 0; i < op->num_alts; i++)
00410     {
00411       /* Get alt and it's IO_item for easy access */
00412       alt = &op->alt[i];
00413       alt_operand_type = alt->IO_item->operand_type;
00414 
00415       /* If alt and io_list operands types are compatable,
00416        * add alt to compatable_alts list in mdes_info.
00417        */
00418       if (IO_items_compatable (lmdes, alt_operand_type, operand_type))
00419         {
00420           comp_alt =
00421             (Mdes_Compatable_Alt *) L_alloc (Mdes_Compatable_Alt_pool);
00422           comp_alt->alt = alt;
00423           comp_alt->next = NULL;
00424 
00425           /* Add to end of linked list */
00426           if (tail == NULL)
00427             info->compatable_alts = comp_alt;
00428           else
00429             tail->next = comp_alt;
00430 
00431           tail = comp_alt;
00432 
00433           /* Update num compatable */
00434           info->num_compatable_alts++;
00435         }
00436     }
00437 
00438   /* Make sure there is at least one compatable alt */
00439   if (info->num_compatable_alts < 1)
00440     {
00441       fprintf (stderr,
00442                "build_mdes_info: No alts for opcode %i match the io_list.\n",
00443                opcode);
00444       return (NULL);
00445     }
00446 
00447   /* Return the info structure just built */
00448   return (info);
00449 }
00450 
00451 void
00452 free_mdes_info (Mdes_Info * info)
00453 {
00454   Mdes_Compatable_Alt *alt, *next_alt;
00455 
00456   for (alt = info->compatable_alts; alt != NULL; alt = next_alt)
00457     {
00458       next_alt = alt->next;
00459       L_free (Mdes_Compatable_Alt_pool, alt);
00460     }
00461   L_free (Mdes_Info_pool, info);
00462 }
00463 
00464 /* 
00465  * Returns the operand index for a specified operand.
00466  * This version also detects 'out of range' operand specification
00467  */
00468 int
00469 operand_index (unsigned int operand_type, unsigned int operand_number)
00470 {
00471   int index;
00472 
00473   /* Make sure legal operand type */
00474   if (operand_type > 4)
00475     I_punt ("operand_index: operand type %i must be between 0 and 4",
00476             operand_type);
00477 
00478   /* Make sure operand_number is not out of bounds */
00479   if ((lmdes != NULL) && (operand_number >= lmdes->number[operand_type]))
00480     I_punt ("operand_index: illegal %s operand number %i (%i defined).",
00481             lmdes->name[operand_type], operand_number,
00482             lmdes->number[operand_type]);
00483 
00484   /* Calculate index */
00485   index = lmdes->offset[operand_type] + operand_number;
00486 
00487   return (index);
00488 }
00489 
00490 /* 
00491  * Returns the operand type for a specified operand_index.
00492  * This version also detects 'out of range' operand_index specification
00493  */
00494 int
00495 operand_type (unsigned int operand_index)
00496 {
00497   int type;
00498 
00499   /* Make sure legal operand_index */
00500   if (operand_index >= lmdes->latency_count)
00501     I_punt ("operand_type: operand index %i must be between 0 and %i",
00502             operand_index, lmdes->latency_count - 1);
00503 
00504   /* Lookup type */
00505   type = lmdes->index_type[operand_index];
00506 
00507   return (type);
00508 }
00509 
00510 /* 
00511  * Returns the operand number for a specified operand_index.
00512  * This version also detects 'out of range' operand_index specification
00513  */
00514 int
00515 operand_number (unsigned int operand_index)
00516 {
00517   int number;
00518 
00519   /* Make sure legal operand_index */
00520   if (operand_index >= lmdes->latency_count)
00521     I_punt
00522       ("operand_number: operand index %i must be between 0 and %i",
00523        operand_index, lmdes->latency_count - 1);
00524 
00525   /* Lookup number */
00526   number = lmdes->index_number[operand_index];
00527 
00528   return (number);
00529 }
00530 
00531 /*
00532  * Returns the maximum operand type for the specified operand
00533  * for the compatable alternatives specified in mdes_info.
00534  */
00535 int
00536 max_operand_time (Mdes_Info * mdes_info, int operand_index)
00537 {
00538   Mdes_Compatable_Alt *compatable_alt;
00539   int max_time;
00540 
00541   if (mdes_info == NULL)
00542     I_punt ("max_operand_type: mdes_info is NULL");
00543 
00544   if (mdes_info->compatable_alts == NULL)
00545     I_punt ("max_operand_type: No compatable alts in mdes_info");
00546 
00547   if (operand_index >= lmdes->latency_count)
00548     I_punt ("max_operand_type: operand_index (%i) out of bounds",
00549             operand_index);
00550 
00551   /* Intiallize max to first alt's operand time */
00552   max_time =
00553     mdes_info->compatable_alts->alt->latency->operand_latency[operand_index];
00554 
00555   /* Search rest of compatable alts for max operand time */
00556   for (compatable_alt = mdes_info->compatable_alts->next;
00557        compatable_alt != NULL; compatable_alt = compatable_alt->next)
00558     {
00559       if (compatable_alt->alt->latency->operand_latency[operand_index] >
00560           max_time)
00561         {
00562           max_time =
00563             compatable_alt->alt->latency->operand_latency[operand_index];
00564         }
00565     }
00566   return (max_time);
00567 }
00568 
00569 /*
00570  * Returns the minimum operand type for the specified operand
00571  * for the compatable alternatives specified in mdes_info.
00572  */
00573 int
00574 min_operand_time (Mdes_Info * mdes_info, int operand_index)
00575 {
00576   Mdes_Compatable_Alt *compatable_alt;
00577   int min_time;
00578 
00579   if (mdes_info == NULL)
00580     I_punt ("min_operand_type: mdes_info is NULL");
00581 
00582   if (mdes_info->compatable_alts == NULL)
00583     I_punt ("min_operand_type: No compatable alts in mdes_info");
00584 
00585   if (operand_index >= lmdes->latency_count)
00586     I_punt ("min_operand_type: operand_index (%i) out of bounds",
00587             operand_index);
00588 
00589   /* Intiallize max to first alt's operand time */
00590   min_time =
00591     mdes_info->compatable_alts->alt->latency->operand_latency[operand_index];
00592 
00593   /* Search rest of compatable alts for max operand time */
00594   for (compatable_alt = mdes_info->compatable_alts->next;
00595        compatable_alt != NULL; compatable_alt = compatable_alt->next)
00596     {
00597       if (compatable_alt->alt->latency->operand_latency[operand_index] <
00598           min_time)
00599         {
00600           min_time =
00601             compatable_alt->alt->latency->operand_latency[operand_index];
00602         }
00603     }
00604   return (min_time);
00605 }
00606 
00607 /*
00608  * Returns the earliest time that one of the compatable alternatives
00609  * for this oper can be scheduled.
00610  */
00611 int
00612 mdes_calc_min_ready_time (Mdes_Info * mdes_info, int *ready_time)
00613 {
00614   Mdes_Compatable_Alt *comp_alt;
00615   int *lat;
00616   int time, min_time;
00617   int i;
00618 
00619   if (mdes_info == NULL)
00620     I_punt ("mdes_calc_min_ready_time: mdes_info is NULL");
00621 
00622   min_time = -1;
00623   for (comp_alt = mdes_info->compatable_alts; comp_alt != NULL;
00624        comp_alt = comp_alt->next)
00625     {
00626       /* Get the latency times for this alt */
00627       lat = comp_alt->alt->latency->operand_latency;
00628 
00629       /* Get max contraint from all operands */
00630       time = 0;
00631       for (i = 0; i < lmdes->latency_count; i++)
00632         {
00633           if ((ready_time[i] - lat[i]) > time)
00634             time = ready_time[i] - lat[i];
00635         }
00636 
00637       /* If this is the first alt looked at, make this the min */
00638       if (min_time == -1)
00639         min_time = time;
00640 
00641       /* Otherwise, take the min of these max constraint times */
00642       else
00643         {
00644           if (min_time > time)
00645             min_time = time;
00646         }
00647     }
00648 
00649   return (min_time);
00650 }
00651 
00652 /*
00653  * Returns the operand latency for the specified alt and operand
00654  */
00655 int
00656 mdes_operand_latency (unsigned int opcode, unsigned int alt_no,
00657                       unsigned int operand_index)
00658 {
00659   Mdes_Operation *op = NULL;
00660   int latency;
00661 
00662   /* Make sure opcode is valid */
00663   if ((opcode > lmdes->max_opcode) ||
00664       ((op = lmdes->op_table[opcode]) == NULL))
00665     {
00666       I_punt ("mdes_operand_latency: opcode (%i) not defined", opcode);
00667     }
00668 
00669   /* Make sure valid alt_no specified */
00670   if (alt_no >= op->num_alts)
00671     {
00672       I_punt ("mdes_operand_latency: alt (%i) >= number of alts (%i)\n",
00673               alt_no, op->num_alts);
00674     }
00675 
00676   /* Make sure operand index is valid */
00677   if (operand_index >= lmdes->latency_count)
00678     I_punt ("mdes_operand_latency: operand_index (%i) out of bounds",
00679             operand_index);
00680 
00681 
00682 
00683   /* Return the operand latency */
00684   latency = op->alt[alt_no].latency->operand_latency[operand_index];
00685   return (latency);
00686 }
00687 
00688 /* 
00689  * This routine is intended to give a "best" choice for an 
00690  * alternative id when an opcode has not been scheduled such
00691  * as when scheduling for infinite issue or for approximating
00692  * the "best" choice for instruction latencies.
00693  *
00694  * Chooses the alternative with the lowest mdes_max_completion_time
00695  * (latency).  In case of ties, the lowest alt number will be
00696  * chosen.
00697  */
00698 int
00699 mdes_heuristic_alt_id (int opcode)
00700 {
00701   Mdes_Operation *op = NULL;
00702   int min_alt;
00703   int latency, min_latency;
00704   int alt;
00705 
00706   /* Make sure opcode is valid */
00707   if ((opcode > lmdes->max_opcode) ||
00708       ((op = lmdes->op_table[opcode]) == NULL))
00709     {
00710       I_punt ("mdes_heuristic_alt_id: opcode (%i) not defined", opcode);
00711     }
00712 
00713   /* If have not already selected the heuristic alt, do it now */
00714   if (op->heuristic_alt < 0)
00715     {
00716       /* Get the latency of the first alternative */
00717       min_alt = 0;
00718       min_latency = mdes_max_completion_time (opcode, min_alt);
00719 
00720       for (alt = 1; alt < op->num_alts; alt++)
00721         {
00722           latency = mdes_max_completion_time (opcode, alt);
00723           if (latency < min_latency)
00724             {
00725               min_latency = latency;
00726               min_alt = alt;
00727             }
00728         }
00729 
00730       /* Set heuristic alt to this "best" alternative */
00731       op->heuristic_alt = min_alt;
00732     }
00733 
00734   return (op->heuristic_alt);
00735 }
00736 
00737 int
00738 mdes_max_completion_time (int opcode, int alt_no)
00739 {
00740   Mdes_Operation *op = NULL;
00741   int i, max_time, num_dests, dest_offset, *lat;
00742 
00743   /* Make sure opcode is valid */
00744   if ((opcode > lmdes->max_opcode) ||
00745       ((op = lmdes->op_table[opcode]) == NULL))
00746     {
00747       I_punt ("mdes_max_completion_time: opcode (%i) not defined", opcode);
00748     }
00749 
00750   /* Make sure valid alt_no specified */
00751   if (alt_no >= op->num_alts)
00752     {
00753       I_punt ("mdes_max_completion_time: alt (%i) >= number of alts (%i)\n",
00754               alt_no, op->num_alts);
00755     }
00756 
00757   max_time = 0;
00758   num_dests = lmdes->number[MDES_DEST];
00759   dest_offset = operand_index (MDES_DEST, 0);
00760   lat = op->alt[alt_no].latency->operand_latency;
00761 
00762   for (i = 0; i < num_dests; i++)
00763     {
00764       if (lat[dest_offset + i] > max_time)
00765         max_time = lat[dest_offset + i];
00766     }
00767 
00768   return (max_time);
00769 }
00770 
00771 
00772 /*
00773  * Loads the low level mdes file and points 'lmdes' at the
00774  * Mdes structure containing the loaded information.
00775  *
00776  * Punts if a .lmdes2 file is passed to it.  If this routine
00777  * is called instead of L_init_lmdes2(), it is assumed that the
00778  * module does not support .lmdes2.
00779  */
00780 void
00781 L_init_lmdes (char *mdes_file_name)
00782 {
00783   int len;
00784 
00785   if (lmdes != NULL)
00786     fprintf (stderr, "John- You need to free the old lmdes file");
00787 
00788   /* Punt if file name ends in .lmdes2 */
00789   len = strlen (mdes_file_name);
00790   if ((len > 7) &&
00791       (mdes_file_name[len - 7] == '.') &&
00792       (mdes_file_name[len - 6] == 'l') &&
00793       (mdes_file_name[len - 5] == 'm') &&
00794       (mdes_file_name[len - 4] == 'd') &&
00795       (mdes_file_name[len - 3] == 'e') &&
00796       (mdes_file_name[len - 2] == 's') && (mdes_file_name[len - 1] == '2'))
00797     {
00798       I_punt ("L_init_lmdes: lmdes2 file unexpected (%s)\n\n"
00799               "This modules either:\n"
00800               "  1) Does not support .lmdes2 resource representation\n"
00801               "  2) or didn't call L_init_lmdes2().\n\n"
00802               "L_init_lmdes() is provided for backward compatibility.\n",
00803               mdes_file_name);
00804     }
00805   else
00806     {
00807       lmdes = load_lmdes (mdes_file_name);
00808     }
00809 
00810   /* Create alloc pools for mdes */
00811   Mdes_Info_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("Mdes_Info", sizeof (Mdes_Info), 4);
00812   Mdes_Compatable_Alt_pool =
00813     L_create_alloc_pool ("Mdes_Compatable_Alt",
00814                          sizeof (Mdes_Compatable_Alt), 4);
00815 }
00816 
00817 /*
00818  * Loads the low level mdes file and points 'lmdes' at the
00819  * Mdes structure containing the loaded information.
00820  *
00821  * Supports both the loading of .lmdes and .lmdes2 files.  Should
00822  * be called by routines that can tolerate both, or the routines
00823  * should check that the proper verson was passed to it (by checking the
00824  * lmdes->mdes2 pointer).
00825  */
00826 void
00827 L_init_lmdes2 (char *mdes_file_name, int num_pred, int num_dest,
00828                int num_src, int num_sync)
00829 {
00830   int len;
00831 
00832   if (lmdes != NULL)
00833     fprintf (stderr, "Currently old lmdes file is not freed (sorry).\n");
00834 
00835   /* Build from md description if file name ends in .lmdes2 */
00836   len = strlen (mdes_file_name);
00837   if ((len > 7) &&
00838       (mdes_file_name[len - 7] == '.') &&
00839       (mdes_file_name[len - 6] == 'l') &&
00840       (mdes_file_name[len - 5] == 'm') &&
00841       (mdes_file_name[len - 4] == 'd') &&
00842       (mdes_file_name[len - 3] == 'e') &&
00843       (mdes_file_name[len - 2] == 's') && (mdes_file_name[len - 1] == '2'))
00844     {
00845 #if 0
00846       printf ("Building mdes version1 structures from version2 mdes!\n");
00847 #endif
00848       lmdes = load_lmdes_from_version2 (mdes_file_name, num_pred, num_dest,
00849                                         num_src, num_sync);
00850     }
00851   else
00852     {
00853       lmdes = load_lmdes (mdes_file_name);
00854     }
00855 
00856   /* Create alloc pools for mdes */
00857   Mdes_Info_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("Mdes_Info", sizeof (Mdes_Info), 4);
00858   Mdes_Compatable_Alt_pool =
00859     L_create_alloc_pool ("Mdes_Compatable_Alt",
00860                          sizeof (Mdes_Compatable_Alt), 4);
00861 }
00862 
00863 
00864 void
00865 Malloc_struct (void **ptr, int size)
00866 {
00867   if ((*ptr = (void *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
00868     I_punt ("Malloc_struct: Out of memory");
00869 }
00870 
00871 void
00872 Malloc_name (char **ptr, char *name)
00873 {
00874   int size;
00875   size = strlen (name) + 1;
00876   if ((*ptr = (char *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
00877     I_punt ("Malloc_name: Out of memory");
00878 
00879   strcpy (*ptr, name);
00880 }
00881 
00882 static void
00883 LM_read_mask (FILE * in, int *mask, int width)
00884 {
00885   int i;
00886   for (i = 0; i < width; i++)
00887     {
00888       if (fscanf (in, "%8x", &mask[i]) != 1)
00889         I_punt ("LM_read_mask: error reading mask");
00890     }
00891 }
00892 
00893 /*
00894  * reads low-level mdes file and builds data structures.
00895  */
00896 static Mdes *
00897 load_lmdes (char *file_name)
00898 {
00899   Mdes *mdes;
00900   FILE *in;
00901   int version;
00902   int struct_size;
00903   int data_size;
00904   int set_table_size;
00905   int rused_size;
00906   int slots_size;
00907   int option_size;
00908   int alt_size;
00909   int buf_size;
00910   int *mask_ptr;
00911   int *array_ptr;
00912   int *slot_ptr;
00913   Mdes_IO_Set **type_ptr;
00914   Mdes_Rused *rused_ptr;
00915   Mdes_Rmask *option_ptr;
00916   Mdes_Alt *alt_ptr;
00917   int total_string_len;
00918   int total_used;
00919   int total_slots;
00920   int total_options;
00921   int total_alts;
00922   Mdes_IO_Set *IO_set;
00923   Mdes_IO_Item *IO_item;
00924   Mdes_Resource *resource;
00925   Mdes_ResList *reslist;
00926   Mdes_Rused *rused;
00927   Mdes_Rmask *option;
00928   Mdes_Latency *latency;
00929   Mdes_Alt *alt;
00930   Mdes_Operation *operation;
00931   char *name_buf_ptr;
00932   int IO_set_id, IO_item_id, reslist_id, latency_id;
00933   int i, j, k, m;
00934 
00935   /* Open the file for reading */
00936   if ((in = fopen (file_name, "r")) == NULL)
00937     I_punt ("load_lmdes: Unable to open mdes file '%s' for reading",
00938             file_name);
00939 
00940   /* Malloc mdes structure and copy file name to field */
00941   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes, sizeof (Mdes));
00942   Malloc_name (&mdes->file_name, file_name);
00943 
00944   /* This is build from version1 file.  Mark by placing NULL in mdes2 */
00945   mdes->mdes2 = NULL;
00946 
00947   /* Read version */
00948   version = -1;
00949   if (fscanf (in, "Lmdes Version %i\n\n", &version) != 1)
00950     I_punt ("load_lmdes: '%s' is not a lmdes file", file_name);
00951 
00952 
00953   /* Make sure file format is what we expect */
00954   if (version != MDES_VERSION)
00955     {
00956       fprintf (stderr,
00957                "load_lmdes: '%s' internal format is incompatable with this "
00958                "reader.\n", file_name);
00959       fprintf (stderr,
00960                "load_lmdes: It's internal version is %i not the expected %i.\n",
00961                version, MDES_VERSION);
00962 
00963       /* Suggest a corrective action */
00964       if (version < MDES_VERSION)
00965         {
00966           fprintf (stderr,
00967                    "load_lmdes: Please rebuild '%s' from the corresponding "
00968                    "hmdes file.\n", file_name);
00969           I_punt ("load_lmdes: The hmdes file Version# does NOT "
00970                   "need to be modified.");
00971         }
00972 
00973       else
00974         {
00975           I_punt ("load_lmdes: Please recompile this program with the new "
00976                   "lmdes library.");
00977         }
00978     }
00979 
00980   /* Read in other paramaters (mainly processor_model) */
00981   fscanf (in, "proc_model: %d\n", &mdes->processor_model);
00982 
00983   /* Read number of src, dest, etc. operands */
00984   fscanf (in, "sizes: %d %d %d %d %d %d %d\n\n",
00985           &mdes->number[MDES_PRED], &mdes->number[MDES_DEST],
00986           &mdes->number[MDES_SRC], &mdes->number[MDES_SYNC_IN],
00987           &mdes->number[MDES_SYNC_OUT], &mdes->max_slot, &mdes->num_slots);
00988 
00989 
00990   /*
00991    * Get total operand count, latency count, and calculate offsets into
00992    * arrays for pred, dest, src, etc. operands
00993    */
00994   mdes->operand_count = mdes->number[MDES_PRED] + mdes->number[MDES_DEST] +
00995     mdes->number[MDES_SRC];
00996 
00997   mdes->latency_count = mdes->operand_count + mdes->number[MDES_SYNC_IN] +
00998     mdes->number[MDES_SYNC_OUT];
00999 
01000   mdes->offset[MDES_PRED] = 0;
01001   mdes->offset[MDES_DEST] = mdes->offset[MDES_PRED] + mdes->number[MDES_PRED];
01002   mdes->offset[MDES_SRC] = mdes->offset[MDES_DEST] + mdes->number[MDES_DEST];
01003   mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_IN] = mdes->offset[MDES_SRC] +
01004     mdes->number[MDES_SRC];
01005   mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_OUT] = mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_IN] +
01006     mdes->number[MDES_SYNC_IN];
01007 
01008   /* Set names for each operand type, for error messages */
01009   mdes->name[MDES_PRED] = "pred";
01010   mdes->name[MDES_DEST] = "dest";
01011   mdes->name[MDES_SRC] = "src";
01012   mdes->name[MDES_SYNC_IN] = "sync_in";
01013   mdes->name[MDES_SYNC_OUT] = "sync_out";
01014 
01015   /* Malloc structures to allow reverse mapping from operand_index
01016    * to operand_type and operand_number.
01017    */
01018   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes->index_type,
01019                  mdes->latency_count * sizeof (int));
01020   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes->index_number,
01021                  mdes->latency_count * sizeof (int));
01022 
01023   /* Init reverse map structure for MDES_PRED */
01024   for (i = 0; i < mdes->number[MDES_PRED]; i++)
01025     {
01026       mdes->index_type[mdes->offset[MDES_PRED] + i] = MDES_PRED;
01027       mdes->index_number[mdes->offset[MDES_PRED] + i] = i;
01028     }
01029 
01030   /* Init reverse map structure for MDES_DEST */
01031   for (i = 0; i < mdes->number[MDES_DEST]; i++)
01032     {
01033       mdes->index_type[mdes->offset[MDES_DEST] + i] = MDES_DEST;
01034       mdes->index_number[mdes->offset[MDES_DEST] + i] = i;
01035     }
01036 
01037   /* Init reverse map structure for MDES_SRC */
01038   for (i = 0; i < mdes->number[MDES_SRC]; i++)
01039     {
01040       mdes->index_type[mdes->offset[MDES_SRC] + i] = MDES_SRC;
01041       mdes->index_number[mdes->offset[MDES_SRC] + i] = i;
01042     }
01043 
01044   /* Init reverse map structure for MDES_SYNC_IN */
01045   for (i = 0; i < mdes->number[MDES_SYNC_IN]; i++)
01046     {
01047       mdes->index_type[mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_IN] + i] = MDES_SYNC_IN;
01048       mdes->index_number[mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_IN] + i] = i;
01049     }
01050 
01051   /* Init reverse map structure for MDES_SYNC_OUT */
01052   for (i = 0; i < mdes->number[MDES_SYNC_OUT]; i++)
01053     {
01054       mdes->index_type[mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_OUT] + i] = MDES_SYNC_OUT;
01055       mdes->index_number[mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_OUT] + i] = i;
01056     }
01057 
01058   if (fscanf (in, "IO_Sets_begin %i %i %i %i %i %i\n", &mdes->IOmask_width,
01059               &mdes->num_reg_files, &mdes->num_IO_sets,
01060               &mdes->null_external_id,
01061               &mdes->max_IO_set_id, &total_string_len) != 6)
01062     I_punt ("load_lmdes: error reading IO_Sets_begin");
01063 
01064 
01065   /* Allocate array of IO_Sets */
01066   struct_size = mdes->num_IO_sets * sizeof (Mdes_IO_Set);
01067   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes->IO_set, struct_size);
01068 
01069   /* Allocate array to map external_id's to IO_Sets */
01070   set_table_size = (mdes->max_IO_set_id + 1) * sizeof (Mdes_IO_Set *);
01071   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes->IO_set_table, set_table_size);
01072 
01073   /* Allocate array of IOmasks */
01074   data_size = mdes->num_IO_sets * (mdes->IOmask_width * sizeof (int));
01075   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mask_ptr, data_size);
01076 
01077   /* Allocate all the name buffer space in one shot */
01078   Malloc_struct ((void **) &name_buf_ptr, total_string_len);
01079 
01080   /* Initialize IO_Set_table to NULL pointers */
01081   for (i = 0; i <= mdes->max_IO_set_id; i++)
01082     mdes->IO_set_table[i] = NULL;
01083 
01084   /* Read in the IO_sets */
01085   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_IO_sets; i++)
01086     {
01087       IO_set = &mdes->IO_set[i];
01088       IO_set->name = name_buf_ptr;
01089       IO_set->mask = mask_ptr;
01090 
01091       fscanf (in, "%i %i %s", &IO_set->id, &IO_set->external_id,
01092               IO_set->name);
01093 
01094       /* Put in IO_Set_table */
01095       if (IO_set->external_id != -1)
01096         mdes->IO_set_table[IO_set->external_id] = IO_set;
01097 
01098       /* Read mask from file */
01099       LM_read_mask (in, IO_set->mask, mdes->IOmask_width);
01100 
01101       /* Move name buf pointer after terminator */
01102       name_buf_ptr += strlen (IO_set->name) + 1;
01103 
01104       /* Move mask pointer after this mask */
01105       mask_ptr += mdes->IOmask_width;
01106 
01107     }
01108   fscanf (in, "\nIO_Sets_end\n\n");
01109 
01110   if (fscanf (in, "IO_Items_begin %i %i\n", &mdes->num_IO_items,
01111               &total_string_len) != 2)
01112     I_punt ("load_lmdes: error reading IO_Items_begin");
01113 
01114   /* Allocate array of IO_Items */
01115   struct_size = mdes->num_IO_items * sizeof (Mdes_IO_Item);
01116   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes->IO_item, struct_size);
01117 
01118   /* Allocate array of operand types */
01119   data_size = mdes->num_IO_items * mdes->operand_count *
01120     sizeof (Mdes_IO_Set *);
01121   Malloc_struct ((void **) &type_ptr, data_size);
01122 
01123   /* Allocate all the name buffer space in one shot */
01124   Malloc_struct ((void **) &name_buf_ptr, total_string_len);
01125 
01126   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_IO_items; i++)
01127     {
01128       IO_item = &mdes->IO_item[i];
01129       IO_item->name = name_buf_ptr;
01130       IO_item->operand_type = type_ptr;
01131 
01132       fscanf (in, "%d %s", &IO_item->id, IO_item->name);
01133 
01134       for (j = 0; j < mdes->operand_count; j++)
01135         {
01136           fscanf (in, "%d", &IO_set_id);
01137 
01138           /* Get pointer to appropriate IO_Set */
01139           IO_item->operand_type[j] = &mdes->IO_set[IO_set_id];
01140         }
01141 
01142       /* Move name buf pointer after terminator */
01143       name_buf_ptr += strlen (IO_item->name) + 1;
01144 
01145       /* Move type ptr to next operand type array */
01146       type_ptr += mdes->operand_count;
01147     }
01148   fscanf (in, "\nIO_Items_end\n\n");
01149 
01150   if (fscanf (in, "Resources_begin %i %i\n", &mdes->num_resources,
01151               &total_string_len) != 2)
01152     I_punt ("load_lmdes: error reading Resources_begin");
01153 
01154   /* Allocate array of resources */
01155   struct_size = mdes->num_resources * sizeof (Mdes_Resource);
01156   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes->resource, struct_size);
01157 
01158   /* Allocate all the name buffer space in one shot */
01159   Malloc_struct ((void **) &name_buf_ptr, total_string_len);
01160 
01161   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_resources; i++)
01162     {
01163       resource = &mdes->resource[i];
01164       resource->name = name_buf_ptr;
01165 
01166       fscanf (in, "%d %s\n", &resource->id, resource->name);
01167 
01168       /* Move name buf pointer after terminator */
01169       name_buf_ptr += strlen (resource->name) + 1;
01170     }
01171   fscanf (in, "\nResources_end\n\n");
01172 
01173   if (fscanf (in, "ResList_begin %d %d %d %d %d %d\n", &mdes->num_reslists,
01174               &total_used, &total_slots, &total_options, &mdes->Rmask_width,
01175               &total_string_len) != 6)
01176     I_punt ("load_lmdes: error reading ResList_begin");
01177 
01178   /* Allocate array of resources */
01179   struct_size = mdes->num_reslists * sizeof (Mdes_ResList);
01180   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes->reslist, struct_size);
01181 
01182   /* Allocate array of Rused structs */
01183   rused_size = total_used * sizeof (Mdes_Rused);
01184   Malloc_struct ((void **) &rused_ptr, rused_size);
01185 
01186   /* Allocate array of slot options */
01187   slots_size = total_slots * sizeof (int);
01188   Malloc_struct ((void **) &slot_ptr, slots_size);
01189 
01190   /* Allocate array of options */
01191   option_size = total_options * sizeof (Mdes_Rmask);
01192   Malloc_struct ((void **) &option_ptr, option_size);
01193 
01194   /* Allocate array of ints for uncond/pred fields of options */
01195   data_size = total_options * 2 * mdes->Rmask_width * sizeof (int);
01196   Malloc_struct ((void **) &array_ptr, data_size);
01197 
01198   /* Allocate all the name buffer space in one shot */
01199   Malloc_struct ((void **) &name_buf_ptr, total_string_len);
01200 
01201   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_reslists; i++)
01202     {
01203       reslist = &mdes->reslist[i];
01204       reslist->name = name_buf_ptr;
01205       reslist->used = rused_ptr;
01206       reslist->slot_options = slot_ptr;
01207 
01208       fscanf (in, "%d %s %d %d %d\n", &reslist->id, reslist->name,
01209               &reslist->num_used, &reslist->num_slot_options,
01210               &reslist->num_RU_entries_required);
01211 
01212       /* Read in slot options */
01213       for (j = 0; j < reslist->num_slot_options; j++)
01214         {
01215           fscanf (in, "%d", &reslist->slot_options[j]);
01216         }
01217       fscanf (in, "\n");
01218 
01219       for (j = 0; j < reslist->num_used; j++)
01220         {
01221           rused = &reslist->used[j];
01222           rused->option = option_ptr;
01223 
01224           fscanf (in, "%d %d %d %d\n", &rused->start_usage,
01225                   &rused->end_usage, &rused->num_options, &rused->flags);
01226 
01227           for (k = 0; k < rused->num_options; k++)
01228             {
01229               option = &rused->option[k];
01230 
01231               /* Grab int arrays of size mdes->Rmask_width for uncond/pred */
01232               option->uncond = array_ptr;
01233               array_ptr += mdes->Rmask_width;
01234               option->pred = array_ptr;
01235               array_ptr += mdes->Rmask_width;
01236 
01237               /* Read in uncond mask */
01238               for (m = 0; m < mdes->Rmask_width; m++)
01239                 {
01240                   fscanf (in, "%8x", &option->uncond[m]);
01241                 }
01242 
01243               /* Read in pred mask */
01244               for (m = 0; m < mdes->Rmask_width; m++)
01245                 {
01246                   fscanf (in, "%8x", &option->pred[m]);
01247                 }
01248             }
01249           /* Move option pointer after this option array */
01250           option_ptr += rused->num_options;
01251         }
01252       /* Move slot pointer after slot option array */
01253       slot_ptr += reslist->num_slot_options;
01254 
01255       /* Move name buf pointer after terminator */
01256       name_buf_ptr += strlen (reslist->name) + 1;
01257 
01258       /* Move rused pointer to free space */
01259       rused_ptr += reslist->num_used;
01260     }
01261   fscanf (in, "\nResList_end\n\n");
01262 
01263   if (fscanf (in, "Latencies_begin %i %i\n", &mdes->num_latencies,
01264               &total_string_len) != 2)
01265     I_punt ("load_lmdes: error reading Latencies_begin");
01266 
01267   /* Allocate array of latencies */
01268   struct_size = mdes->num_latencies * sizeof (Mdes_Latency);
01269   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes->latency, struct_size);
01270 
01271   /* Allocate all operand_latency arrays in one shot */
01272   data_size = mdes->num_latencies * mdes->latency_count * sizeof (int);
01273   Malloc_struct ((void **) &array_ptr, data_size);
01274 
01275   /* Allocate all the name buffer space in one shot */
01276   Malloc_struct ((void **) &name_buf_ptr, total_string_len);
01277 
01278   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_latencies; i++)
01279     {
01280       latency = &mdes->latency[i];
01281       latency->name = name_buf_ptr;
01282       latency->operand_latency = array_ptr;
01283 
01284       fscanf (in, "%d %s %d", &latency->id, latency->name,
01285               &latency->exception);
01286 
01287       for (j = 0; j < mdes->latency_count; j++)
01288         {
01289           fscanf (in, "%d", &latency->operand_latency[j]);
01290         }
01291 
01292       /* Move name buf pointer after terminator */
01293       name_buf_ptr += strlen (latency->name) + 1;
01294 
01295       /* Move operand latency array ptr to next array */
01296       array_ptr += mdes->latency_count;
01297     }
01298   fscanf (in, "\nLatencies_end\n\n");
01299 
01300 
01301   if (fscanf (in, "Operations_begin %i %i %i %i\n",
01302               &mdes->num_operations, &total_alts,
01303               &mdes->max_opcode, &total_string_len) != 4)
01304     I_punt ("load_lmdes: error reading Operations_begin");
01305 
01306   /* Allocate array of Operations */
01307   struct_size = mdes->num_operations * sizeof (Mdes_Operation);
01308   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes->operation, struct_size);
01309 
01310   /* Allocate all alts in one shot */
01311   alt_size = total_alts * sizeof (Mdes_Alt);
01312   Malloc_struct ((void **) &alt_ptr, alt_size);
01313 
01314   /* Allocate op_table (indexed by opcode) */
01315   data_size = (mdes->max_opcode + 1) * sizeof (Mdes_Operation *);
01316   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes->op_table, data_size);
01317 
01318   /* Allocate all the name buffer space in one shot */
01319   Malloc_struct ((void **) &name_buf_ptr, total_string_len);
01320 
01321 
01322   /* Intialize all op_table pointers to NULL */
01323   for (i = 0; i <= mdes->max_opcode; i++)
01324     mdes->op_table[i] = NULL;
01325 
01326   /* Read in operations */
01327   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_operations; i++)
01328     {
01329       operation = &mdes->operation[i];
01330       operation->external_name = name_buf_ptr;
01331       operation->alt = alt_ptr;
01332       operation->id = i;
01333       operation->heuristic_alt = -1;    /* Used for heuristics */
01334 
01335       fscanf (in, "%d %s %d %x\n", &operation->opcode,
01336               operation->external_name,
01337               &operation->num_alts, &operation->op_flags);
01338 
01339       /* Insert into op_table */
01340       mdes->op_table[operation->opcode] = operation;
01341 
01342       /* Move name buf pointer after terminator */
01343       name_buf_ptr += strlen (operation->external_name) + 1;
01344 
01345       /* Read in alts for operation */
01346       for (j = 0; j < operation->num_alts; j++)
01347         {
01348           alt = &operation->alt[j];
01349           alt->id = j;
01350           alt->asm_name = name_buf_ptr;
01351           alt->operation = operation;
01352 
01353           fscanf (in, "%s %x %d %d %d\n", alt->asm_name,
01354                   &alt->alt_flags, &IO_item_id, &reslist_id, &latency_id);
01355 
01356           /* Point at appropriate structures using ids */
01357           alt->IO_item = &mdes->IO_item[IO_item_id];
01358           alt->reslist = &mdes->reslist[reslist_id];
01359           alt->table = NULL;    /* Since loading .lmdes not .lmdes2 */
01360           alt->latency = &mdes->latency[latency_id];
01361 
01362           /* Move name buf pointer after terminator */
01363           name_buf_ptr += strlen (alt->asm_name) + 1;
01364         }
01365 
01366       /* Move alt ptr to next alt array */
01367       alt_ptr += operation->num_alts;
01368     }
01369   fscanf (in, "\nOperations_end\n\n");
01370 
01371   /* Allocate temporary buffers used by Mdes routines */
01372   buf_size = mdes->operand_count * sizeof (Mdes_IO_Set *);
01373   Malloc_struct ((void **) &mdes->operand_type_buf, buf_size);
01374 
01375   /* Initialize mdes2 parameters to their implicit values for mdes1 */
01376   mdes->check_resources_for_only_one_alt = 0;
01377 
01378   return (mdes);
01379 }
01380 
01381 /*
01382  * Writes mdes file to out in a format simular to the low-level format 
01383  */
01384 void
01385 print_mdes (FILE * out, Mdes * mdes)
01386 {
01387   Mdes_IO_Set *IO_set;
01388   Mdes_IO_Item *IO_item;
01389   Mdes_Resource *resource;
01390   Mdes_ResList *reslist;
01391   Mdes_Rused *rused;
01392   Mdes_Rmask *option;
01393   Mdes_Latency *latency;
01394   Mdes_Alt *alt;
01395   Mdes_Operation *operation;
01396   int i, j, k, m;
01397 
01398   /* Debug, print out internal data structures contents  */
01399   fprintf (out, "\nSizes  : ");
01400   fprintf (out, "%i %i %i %i %i\n",
01401            mdes->number[MDES_PRED], mdes->number[MDES_DEST],
01402            mdes->number[MDES_SRC], mdes->number[MDES_SYNC_IN],
01403            mdes->number[MDES_SYNC_OUT]);
01404 
01405   fprintf (out, "\nOffsets: ");
01406   fprintf (out, "%i %i %i %i %i\n",
01407            mdes->offset[MDES_PRED], mdes->offset[MDES_DEST],
01408            mdes->offset[MDES_SRC], mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_IN],
01409            mdes->offset[MDES_SYNC_OUT]);
01410 
01411   fprintf (out, "\nIO_sets:\n");
01412   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_IO_sets; i++)
01413     {
01414       IO_set = &mdes->IO_set[i];
01415       fprintf (out, "%2i %2i %-11s ", IO_set->id, IO_set->external_id,
01416                IO_set->name);
01417       for (j = 0; j < mdes->IOmask_width; j++)
01418         fprintf (out, "%08x ", IO_set->mask[j]);
01419       fprintf (out, "\n");
01420     }
01421 
01422   fprintf (out, "\nIO_Items:\n");
01423   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_IO_items; i++)
01424     {
01425       IO_item = &mdes->IO_item[i];
01426       fprintf (out, "%2i %-11s ", IO_item->id, IO_item->name);
01427       for (j = 0; j < mdes->operand_count; j++)
01428         fprintf (out, "%2i ", IO_item->operand_type[j]->id);
01429       fprintf (out, "\n");
01430     }
01431 
01432   fprintf (out, "\nResources:\n");
01433   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_resources; i++)
01434     {
01435       resource = &mdes->resource[i];
01436       fprintf (out, "%2i %-11s\n", resource->id, resource->name);
01437     }
01438 
01439   fprintf (out, "\nResList:\n");
01440   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_reslists; i++)
01441     {
01442       reslist = &mdes->reslist[i];
01443 
01444       fprintf (out, "%2i %-11s %2i %2i %2i\n", reslist->id, reslist->name,
01445                reslist->num_used, reslist->num_slot_options,
01446                reslist->num_RU_entries_required);
01447 
01448       fprintf (out, "  ");
01449       for (j = 0; j < reslist->num_slot_options; j++)
01450         {
01451           fprintf (out, "%2i ", reslist->slot_options[j]);
01452         }
01453       fprintf (out, "\n");
01454 
01455       for (j = 0; j < reslist->num_used; j++)
01456         {
01457           rused = &reslist->used[j];
01458 
01459           fprintf (out, "  %2i %2i %2i\n", rused->start_usage,
01460                    rused->end_usage, rused->num_options);
01461 
01462           for (k = 0; k < rused->num_options; k++)
01463             {
01464               option = &rused->option[k];
01465 
01466               fprintf (out, "    ");
01467               for (m = 0; m < mdes->Rmask_width; m++)
01468                 {
01469                   fprintf (out, "%08x ", option->uncond[m]);
01470                 }
01471               fprintf (out, "  ");
01472               for (m = 0; m < mdes->Rmask_width; m++)
01473                 {
01474                   fprintf (out, "%08x ", option->pred[m]);
01475                 }
01476               fprintf (out, "\n");
01477             }
01478         }
01479     }
01480 
01481   fprintf (out, "\nLatencies:\n");
01482   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_latencies; i++)
01483     {
01484       latency = &mdes->latency[i];
01485       fprintf (out, "%2i %-11s %2i ", latency->id, latency->name,
01486                latency->exception);
01487 
01488       for (j = 0; j < mdes->latency_count; j++)
01489         {
01490           fprintf (out, "%2i ", latency->operand_latency[j]);
01491         }
01492       fprintf (out, "\n");
01493     }
01494 
01495   fprintf (out, "\nOperations:\n");
01496   for (i = 0; i < mdes->num_operations; i++)
01497     {
01498       operation = &mdes->operation[i];
01499 
01500       fprintf (out, "%3i %-11s %2i %08x\n", operation->opcode,
01501                operation->external_name, operation->num_alts,
01502                operation->op_flags);
01503       for (j = 0; j < operation->num_alts; j++)
01504         {
01505           alt = &operation->alt[j];
01506 
01507           fprintf (out, "   %-11s %08x  %2i %2i %2i\n",
01508                    alt->asm_name, alt->alt_flags, alt->IO_item->id,
01509                    alt->reslist->id, alt->latency->id);
01510         }
01511     }
01512 
01513   fprintf (out, "\nOperations sorted by opcode (testing mdes->op_table):\n");
01514   for (i = 0; i <= mdes->max_opcode; i++)
01515     {
01516       if (mdes->op_table[i] != NULL)
01517         fprintf (out, "%4i %-11s\n", mdes->op_table[i]->opcode,
01518                  mdes->op_table[i]->external_name);
01519     }
01520 }
